faqs.question: Can adults be diagnosed with ADHD?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! Many adults are diagnosed with ADHD later in life. Adult ADHD can manifest differently than childhood ADHD, often involving difficulties with organization, time management, and maintaining focus in work or relationships.

faqs.question: How long does the assessment process take?
faqs.answer: A comprehensive ADHD assessment typically takes 2-3 sessions, including clinical interviews, standardized questionnaires, and cognitive testing. We'll provide you with a detailed report and recommendations.

faqs.question: Do you work with children and adolescents?
faqs.answer: Yes, we provide ADHD assessment and support for children, adolescents, and adults. We work closely with families and schools to ensure comprehensive support.

faqs.question: What if I have ADHD and other mental health conditions?
faqs.answer: ADHD often co-occurs with anxiety, depression, and other conditions. We provide integrated treatment that addresses all aspects of your mental health.

faqs.question: Do you provide medication management?
faqs.answer: While we don't prescribe medication, we can work collaboratively with your doctor or psychiatrist if medication is part of your treatment plan.

faqs.question: Can ADHD be treated without medication?
faqs.answer: Yes! While medication can be helpful for some people, there are many effective non-medication approaches including therapy, behavioral strategies, and lifestyle modifications.

faqs.question: How can I support my child with ADHD?
faqs.answer: We provide parent education and support to help you understand your child's ADHD, develop effective parenting strategies, and create a supportive home environment.

philosophy.title: Is ADHD Diagnosis and Support Right For You?

sections.title: Understanding ADHD as a Neurodevelopmental Difference
sections.description: We view ADHD as a neurodevelopmental difference that affects attention, impulse control, and executive functioning. Our approach focuses on understanding your unique ADHD profile and developing strategies that work with your brain, not against it.

sections.title: Strengths-Based Support and Empowerment
sections.description: We believe that ADHD comes with unique strengths and talents. Our approach helps you identify and leverage these strengths while developing practical strategies to manage challenges. We focus on building confidence and self-acceptance.

sections.title: Evidence-Based ADHD Management
sections.description: We combine proven therapeutic approaches including cognitive-behavioral therapy, executive function coaching, and mindfulness techniques. Our goal is to help you develop practical skills for managing ADHD symptoms and creating systems that support your success.

sections.title: Comprehensive Life Integration
sections.description: We take a holistic approach to ADHD support, addressing academic, work, relationship, and daily life challenges. We work with you to create sustainable strategies that help you thrive in all areas of your life while embracing your unique ADHD traits.
